page.title: 01GAZETTEER ENTRY COWFOLD.
page.content: {COWFOLD}is a village in The Sussex Weald between Horsham and The Downs. There are 1500 inhabitants.A feature of the village is the large 13th. century church of St Peter with its row of houses enclosing the churchyard on two sides.Cowfold stands at the junction of two main roads the A272 and the A281.Both of these roads are very busy and heavily used by lorries. Cowfold is fortunate in having a range of shops,but shopping is difficult due to the traffic and parking is restricted.Many villagers feel that Cowfold needs a bypass.The countryside around is wooded.The farms are mainly stock and dairy farms.There is a small Industrial Estate at Oakendene just outside the village.Many people work at Gatwick Airport and some commute to London.A new estate is being built at present of 150 houses.
